title: Ladakh violence: 'Gen Z revolution' or 'conspiracy motivated by politics'? What we know
content: A demonstration in Leh demanding statehood for Ladakh turned violent, resulting in casualties and injuries. Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk expressed sadness over the escalation, while the BJP alleged Congress involvement in instigating the unrest. The protests stem from frustrations over unfulfilled promises and lack of local control, with talks scheduled to address the demands.

title: Comedian-in-chief: Trump at UN - why world no longer takes him seriously
content: At the UN General Assembly, Donald Trump's speech, criticizing the UN and international norms, drew reactions of pity rather than concern. His 'America First' approach is isolating the US, prompting allies to question its reliability. Nations are hedging their bets, drawing closer to China and Russia, as Trump's unpredictability undermines US credibility.

title: Asia Cup | India in final: Red-hot Abhishek Sharma blasts 37-ball 75 to dismantle Bangladesh
content: Abhishek Sharma’s blazing 37-ball 75 powered India into the Asia Cup final with a 41-run win over Bangladesh in Dubai. His assault set the tone as India posted 168/6, before Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakaravarthy and Jasprit Bumrah dismantled Bangladesh for 127. Saif Hassan’s lone 69 wasn’t enough as India sealed back-to-back wins in the Super Four stage of the tournament.

title: J&K man arrested for helping Pahalgam terrorists
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police have apprehended Mohammad Kataria, a Kulgam resident, for allegedly aiding the Pakistan-backed terrorists involved in the deadly April 22 Pahalgam attack that killed 26 tourists. Kataria is accused of providing crucial logistical support to the terrorists.

title: Infrastructure push: PM Modi tells bureaucrats to clear bottlenecks; focus on results
content: PM Narendra Modi chaired a Pragati meeting. He urged officials to resolve infrastructure project issues. He asked them not to wait for reviews. The PM emphasized better coordination. He wants faster project execution. He reviewed eight critical projects. These projects cover mines, railways and water resources. The projects span 15 states and UTs. The cumulative investment is over Rs 65,000 crore.

title: World’s 2nd richest man to donate 95% of wealth
content: Oracle's founder, Larry Ellison, now the world's second richest person with a $373 billion net worth, plans to donate 95% of his wealth. Moving away from traditional charities, Ellison is focusing his philanthropic efforts through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT) at Oxford, addressing global issues like healthcare and climate change.

title: Asia Cup: No handshakes between IND-BAN players? Pic reveals truth
content: Speculation arose about a potential handshake snub between India and Bangladesh after their Asia Cup match. Visuals confirmed the teams exchanged handshakes, maintaining sporting spirit. Abhishek Sharma's explosive innings and strong bowling performances led India to victory. India secured a spot in the final. Bangladesh will face Pakistan to determine the other finalist, raising hopes for another India-Pakistan match.

title: America’s loss, Germany's gain? Berlin seeks more tech workers from India
content: Germany is poised to welcome more Indian IT professionals and students, capitalizing on the US H-1B visa program changes. Ambassador Philipp Ackermann highlights Germany's liberal immigration laws, streamlined visa processes, and growing Indian community.

title: Tough day! Samson drops catch during IND vs BAN match - Watch
content: India secured their Asia Cup 2025 final berth with a dominant 41-run victory over Bangladesh in Dubai, despite Sanju Samson's mixed performance, where he dropped a catch and didn't get to bat. Suryakumar Yadav's team posted 168/6, powered by Abhishek Sharma's explosive 75, while Bangladesh faltered in their chase, managing only 127.

title: Silicon Valley investor slams H-1B changes: Benefits foreign rivals; misguided
content: Silicon Valley investor Michael Moritz has denounced President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it will stifle innovation and reflects a misunderstanding of the tech sector's success. He argues that companies hire skilled foreign nationals due to labor shortages, not to replace American workers.

title: Charlie Kirk death: Joe Rogan questions official theory; hints cover-up
content: Joe Rogan has cast doubt on the official narrative surrounding the Charlie Kirk shooting, where the conservative activist tragically died. Rogan highlighted unusual details, such as a decoy suspect and the alleged use of a World War I rifle by the shooter, Tyler Robinson. Robinson, now in custody, faces multiple charges, including aggravated murder, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix calls it 'tax'; founder says it will end lotteries
content: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: Asia Cup: 'Mera Bumrah ek taraf': Wife Sanjana steals the show
content: During the Asia Cup 2025 Super Four match between India and Bangladesh, actors Bobby Deol and Raghav Juyal joined host Sanjana Ganesan for a lighthearted interview. Deol expressed his excitement and admiration for Jasprit Bumrah's bowling. Juyal added humor by playfully praising Bumrah, even prompting Ganesan, Bumrah's wife, to join in the fun, creating a memorable moment for fans.

title: 'Don't want to punish India': US energy sec says New Delhi doesn't need to buy Russian oil
content: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright has urged India to reconsider its Russian oil imports, emphasizing the availability of alternative sources and alleging that these purchases fund the war in Ukraine. He highlighted the potential for stronger US-India energy and trade cooperation, stating America's willingness to sell oil and end the conflict.

title: Gabrielle Union: ‘No job is worth unease’—on Hollywood’s dark side
content: Popular actress Gabrielle Union revealed how a past sexual assault shaped her Hollywood career. She avoids projects with unsettling individuals, prioritizing her well-being. Union values positive environments over financial gain. Despite past trauma, she achieved success. Her marriage to Dwyane Wade is strong. The couple focuses on family and business ventures. Wade supports Union, and they navigate life together.

title: Agassi–Graf 2025 net worth: Inside tennis power couple’s fortune
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: Why Guardians’ David Fry was hospitalized during key Tigers win
content: In a shocking incident, David Fry was injured during a game between the Cleveland Guardians and the Detroit Tigers. A fastball hit Fry in the face. He was immediately taken to the hospital for treatment. The game continued, and the Guardians secured a victory. The team and players expressed their concern for Fry's well-being.

title: Asia Cup: New record! Bangladesh bowler creates history against India
content: Mustafizur Rahman etched his name in cricket history by becoming Bangladesh's highest wicket-taker in T20Is, achieving the 150-wicket milestone during the Asia Cup match against India. He surpassed Shakib Al Hasan's record and joined an elite group of bowlers globally. Rahman's impressive stats and variations have solidified his importance to Bangladesh's T20I success.

title: 'Tiger kaun?' Shaheen Afridi press conference turns hilarious - Watch
content: During a pre-match press conference in Dubai, Shaheen Shah Afridi's amusing moment occurred when he momentarily forgot Bangladesh's cricket nickname, "Tigers," prompting a lighthearted exchange. Despite Bangladesh's recent T20I struggles against Pakistan, Afridi acknowledged their improved performance and emphasised the importance of delivering the first blow in their upcoming Super Fours match.

title: 'I'll take you on foreign trips': Delhi institute director's sleazy messages to students
content: Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, director of an institute in Vasant Kunj, faces a police case after over 15 students alleged sexual harassment. He sent inappropriate messages, made coercive promises, and issued threats. Police have accessed WhatsApp chats, recorded student statements, and seized a luxury car with a fake UN plate.

title: Abhishek shatters another Yuvraj record, repeats Pak heroics vs Ban
content: Abhishek Sharma continued his sensational form at the Asia Cup, surpassing Yuvraj Singh's record for the most T20I half-centuries in 25 balls or fewer by an Indian. Following his record-breaking innings against Pakistan, where he scored a 24-ball fifty, Abhishek smashed another quick half-century against Bangladesh, reaching the milestone in just 25 balls.

title: Yemen drone attack: Projectile strikes Israeli city of Eilat; over 22 injured
content: A drone launched from Yemen struck Eilat, a city in southern Israel, injuring at least 22 people. Two individuals are in serious condition due to shrapnel wounds. The attack, which occurred near a hotel in a shopping district, follows a previous Houthi drone strike on a Red Sea resort hotel. The Iron Dome interceptors failed to stop the drone.

title: Trump turns against Putin: US Prez says Ukraine can win with Nato support
content: In a surprising shift, US President Donald Trump now believes Ukraine can reclaim its territory with EU and NATO support, following a meeting with President Zelenskyy. Trump criticized Russia's prolonged war effort and hinted at potential tariffs. Zelenskyy, addressing the UNGA, urged immediate action against Russia, citing the rising costs of long-term defense.

title: CBSE 2026: Tentative schedule for class 10, 12 out; direct link for datesheet
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released the tentative datesheet for the 2026 Class 10 and 12 board exams. The examinations will commence on February 17, 2026, with Class 10 concluding on March 9 and Class 12 ending on April 9. Most papers will run from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, while select subjects are scheduled for shorter durations. A supplementary exam for Class 10 begins May 15, 2026.

title: Ind vs Ban: Who's it? Abhishek blows a kiss towards a special person
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting continued in the Asia Cup, highlighted by a rapid half-century against Bangladesh. Surpassing Yuvraj Singh, he now holds five scores of fifty or more in 25 balls or fewer in T20Is. His knock of 75, combined with Shubman Gill's contribution, propelled India to a very strong start.

title: Ladakh violence: Leh admin imposes curfew; 4 dead, over 40 injured in violence
content: Sonam Wangchuk halted his hunger strike as protests demanding Ladakh's statehood turned violent, with vandalism reported in Leh. Authorities imposed restrictions, including banning gatherings, after agitators torched a BJP office and clashed with police. The protests, driven by the Leh Apex Body youth wing, advocate for statehood and Sixth Schedule status.

title: Asia Cup | 'I can do the villain role for my country': Sanju Samson
content: Sanju Samson draws inspiration from actor Mohanlal, embracing versatility in India's T20I setup. Despite excelling as an opener with three centuries, he's ready to adapt to middle-order responsibilities, similar to Mohanlal's diverse roles. While adjusting, Samson's commitment to the team remains strong, even as his performance in the new role is still evolving.

title: Jalen Hurts net worth: How the Eagles star built a million dollar fortune
content: Jalen Hurts' remarkable journey from a promising draft pick to a Super Bowl champion has significantly boosted his financial standing. His estimated net worth in 2025 is $50 million, fueled by a lucrative contract extension with the Eagles and strategic endorsement deals with brands like Nike's Jordan Brand and Pepsi. His innovative business approach further enhances his brand and marketability.

title: Zelenskyy at UN: Ukraine prez warns of 'most destructive arms race'
content: President Zelenskyy addressed the UNGA, asserting Russia's refusal to negotiate peace is prolonging the Ukraine war, causing immense suffering and displacement. He warned of escalating global arms race, urging immediate action to halt Russia's aggression and prevent a wider catastrophe. Zelenskyy emphasized the need for robust security guarantees for all nations, not just a select few, to ensure global safety.

title: Jimmy Kimmel returns: Why the joke is on America
content: Trump didn’t even have a functioning teleprompter. And yet he was funnier, than Jimmy Fallon, Stephen Colbert, John Oliver, and any other “comedian” that clings to a desk at 11PM and pretends to be America’s “conscience.” He was born with better comic timing than their monologues ever had. Every rally he holds is essentially a comedy special, complete with callbacks, audience interaction, and improv. No writers’ room, no punch-up meetings—just a septuagenarian free-styling nonsense that makes his crowd laugh harder than any Kimmel bit.

title: Donald Trump's immigration curbs shatter Indian students' dream
content: Donald Trump's proposed H-1B visa fee hike, potentially reaching $100,000, has jeopardized the aspirations of numerous Indian students seeking education and careers in the US. This policy shift prompts many to explore alternative destinations like Canada, the UK, and Australia, while countries like Germany and China actively attract international talent, potentially impacting America's global competitiveness.

title: Economy no longer Trump’s strength, here's what he is doing better this term
content: President Trump's political strengths have shifted, with the economy no longer a major advantage, particularly among independents. He now relies on border security and crime, though approval on crime has dipped slightly. While foreign policy remains steady, support regarding the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has decreased across party lines, impacting his overall approval ratings.

title: Asia Cup: No handshake snub! India continue tradition against B'desh
content: Before the Asia Cup Super Fours match, Suryakumar Yadav and Jaker Ali shook hands. This gesture continues a pattern of avoiding handshakes with Pakistani players. Earlier, Suryakumar avoided shaking hands with Salman Agha. Jakier Ali chose to bowl first after winning the toss. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate praised Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman. Mustafizur is close to reaching 150 T20I wickets.

title: Ladakh violence: BJP accuses Cong of inciting mob; gets a reply from Wangchuk
content: The BJP has accused Congress councillor Phuntsog Stanzin Tsepag of inciting violence during recent protests in Ladakh, sparked by demands for statehood and inclusion under the Sixth Schedule. These protests, which saw the BJP office and vehicles set ablaze, led to activist Sonam Wangchuk calling for peace and expressing sorrow over the vandalism.

title: In Tamil Nadu, Congress Woman MP Quotes Alliance Dharma, Takes On DMK Leader
content: The tug of war between Tamil Nadu's ruling DMK and its ally Congress in Karur, where Congress MP Jothimani has accused DMK District Secretary V Senthil Balaji of disrespecting the Grand Old Party.

title: Man Robbed Of Jewellery At Gunpoint Near Delhi's Bharat Mandapam
content: A man carrying jewellery on his scooter was allegedly robbed at gunpoint on Wednesday by bike-borne assailants near Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, police said.

title: Lalu Yadav's Daughter Rohini Acharya Issues Open Challenge Amid Family Rift
content: As preparations for the Bihar Assembly elections gather pace, internal discord within the Lalu Prasad Yadav family continues to deepen.

title: Delhi Baba Facing Sexual Harassment Charges Allegedly Authored 28 Books
content: A 62-year-old self-styled godman, accused of sexual harassment by multiple students at a private management institute in New Delhi, has allegedly authored 28 books featuring forewords and reviews by prominent personalities, officials said.

title: 'I Will Come Out Clean': Azam Khan On Court Cases; Denies Joining BSP
content: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan on Wednesday said he was confident of getting justice and coming out clean in the many court cases against him, while firmly rejecting speculation about his joining the Bahujan Samaj Party.

title: Who Is Agastya Goel? Indian-Origin Teen Seen With Trump After US Olympiad Win
content: The United States' Physics team made history at the 2025 International Physics Olympiad in Paris by capturing all five gold medals. Team members Agastya Goel, Allen Li, Joshua Wang, Feodor Yevtushenko, and Brian Zhang ensured the historic sweep.

title: Renowned Kannada Novelist SL Bhyrappa Dies At 94
content: Popular Kannada novelist and philosopher S L Bhyrappa died due to cardiac arrest at a private hospital here on Wednesday.

title: Argentina President Praises Donald Trump For Saving World From "Catastrophe"
content: Argentine President Javier Milei on Wednesday praised key ally Donald Trump for saving the United States and the world from "catastrophe," citing the US president's migration and trade policies.

title: 6 Maoists Carrying Rs 62 Lakh Bounty Surrender In Maharashtra
content: Six Maoists, including three women, carrying cumulative rewards of Rs 62 lakh, surrendered in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Wednesday, police said.

title: Chhattisgarh Liquor Scam: Ex Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's Son Arrested
content: ACB/EOW on Wednesday arrested Chaitanya Baghel, son of former chief minister Bhupesh Baghel, and another accused in connection with the alleged liquor scam, officials said.

title: Monsoon Exits Delhi Early, Earliest Withdrawal Since 2002
content: The southwest monsoon has officially withdrawn from Delhi and adjoining regions a day ahead of its usual schedule, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Wednesday.

title: BJP, Congress Spar Over National Award For Shah Rukh Khan
content: Former BJP MLA Raj Purohit has said that the Congress governments did not give any awards to Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan, but his party judges the actor purely on merit.

title: BJP Versus Trinamool After Mamata Banerjee's Dandiya At Kolkata Puja Pandal
content: Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee today joined women at a puja pandal in Kolkata in a few steps of Dandiya.

title: Delhi BMW Accident Accused Says 'Wrong To Say Car Hit Bike'
content: Gaganpreet Kaur, accused in the Dhaula Kuan BMW case, on Wednesday claimed through her counsel that her car did not hit the motorbike and she rushed the victim to the hospital within 24 minutes of the accident.

title: Sunjay Kapur's Wife To Share Personal Assets Info, Seeks Confidentiality
content: Priya Sachdev Kapur, the third wife of industrialist Sunjay Kapur who died in June, has filed an application in the Delhi High Court seeking a non-disclosure agreement against revealing her late husband's personal assets.

title: Delhi Government To Build 'Silt Traps' Along Drains To Prevent Waterlogging
content: The Delhi government has unveiled a Drainage Master Plan that proposes the construction of 'silt traps' along major drains to prevent waterlogging.

title: Kerala Celebs Under Lens As Probe Agency Takes Up Bhutan Car Smuggling Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) will probe the high-profile Bhutan car smuggling racket after a nudge from the Kerala High Court.

title: Luxury Train To Run For President Murmu's Visit To Mathura
content: The Indian Railways will deploy one of the world's most luxurious trains -- the Maharajas' Express -- to carry President Droupadi Murmu from Safdarjung railway station in New Delhi to Vrindavan Road station near Mathura on Thursday morning.

title: Class 10 Student Dies By Suicide Over 'Low Marks' In Gurugram
content: A 15-year-old class 10 student allegedly committed suicide by jumping from the balcony of his 19th-floor house in Ramprastha City Society in Sector 37D, police said on Wednesday.

title: Minor Couple In Live-In Relationship Has Baby In Jharkhand
content: A 14-year-old girl who is in a live-in relationship with a boy two years older than her gave birth to a baby in Khunti district of Jharkhand, prompting the administration to decide on intensifying its campaign to prevent early marriage and pregnancy

title: ‘A filmmaker is a fairer god’: Mahesh Bhatt on crafting love stories - Exclusive
content: Mahesh Bhatt's upcoming romantic musical, 'Tu Meri Poori Kahani,' explores the dilemma of choosing between love and fame, drawing from director Suhrita Das's real-life experiences. Bhatt emphasizes the film's realistic portrayal of modern women's challenges and its potential to offer solace in turbulent times. He hopes the film, starring debutants, will resonate with audiences and generate positive word-of-mouth.

title: Ind vs Pak: Did Gambhir send Rinku to calm down Shubman and Abhishek ? - Video
content: The high-voltage India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash witnessed heated exchanges both on and off the field. Indian openers Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill were involved in confrontations with Pakistani pacer Haris Rauf, escalating tensions. Rauf further stoked controversy with a provocative gesture towards the crowd, referencing unverified claims of downing Indian jets.

title: Bihar SIR, PM Modi's 'huglomacy', Gaza: CWC resolution adopted at Patna meet
content: The Congress Working Committee convened in Patna, criticizing the Centre's foreign policy, asserting that Prime Minister Modi's 'huglomacy' has backfired, leading to India's diplomatic isolation and failure to protect national interests. The party addressed assembly election strategies and accused the BJP of "vote chori.

title: Former BJP MP’s remarks worry party leadership in poll-bound Bihar
content: Raj Kumar Singh says he lost the 2024 LS poll owing to ‘conspiracy’ by BJP and JD(U) leaders; he also wants corruption-accused BJP leaders to either clear their names or step down

title: Local, who ‘helped’ Pahalgam attackers, arrested in Kashmir Valley: officials
content: According to police, 26-year-old Muhammad Yousuf Katari, a resident of Kulgam, worked as an overground worker for the terror outfit behind the Pahalgam attack, which left 26 civilians dead

title: CPI demands that Chandigarh be transferred to Punjab
content: The CPI passed a resolution declaring that Chandigarh is the capital of Punjab and should be given to that State

title: Conspiracy angle in Delhi riots case politically motivated, say activists, lawyers
content: Right to disagree is the soul of democracy, says former judge Ansari; speakers seek bail for Umar Khalid and others languishing in jail for over five years without trial

title: ‘Psycho killer’ Parmar shot dead during crime scene reconstruction in Ahmedabad
content: Parmar allegedly snatched a firearm from a patrol team personnel and opened fire while attempting to escape. The police retaliated, leading to his death on spot, says DGP Vikas Sahay

title: Sivaganga custodial death case: CBI gets six weeks to complete probe into custodial death case
content: A Division Bench of Justices Anita Sumanth and C. Kumarappan also directed the CBI to complete the probe into the alleged theft of jewellery linked to the case, and file the final report in both cases.

title: Extension of service of Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan
content: He shall also continue to function as Secretary to the Government of India, Department of Military Affairs

title: NIA takes over probe into ₹18.85-crore bank robbery in 2023
content: The robbery happened on November 30, 2023, and was allegedly committed by armed operatives of the Eastern Flank of the National Socialist Council of Nagaland/Isak Muivah, led by one P. Joseph

title: JPC on simultaneous polls meets three economists
content: Sources said Montek Singh Ahluwalia maintained there was no evidence to show simultaneous elections would increase GDP by 1.5%; Arvind Panagariya and Surjit S. Bhalla concurred with report of High-Level Committee

title: Dasara celebrations: Rain likely to play spoilsport in Vijayawada
content: Heavy to very heavy rainfall expected in the city on September 26 and 27; IMD predicts heavy rain forecast for the State, thanks to a fresh low-pressure area that is likely to form on September 25

title: Supreme Court urged to factor in judicial officers’ prior experience as lawyers to fill vacancies
content: Petitions to the top court call for an ‘integrated’ approach to filling up the over 5,000 vacancies in district courts

title: BJP dismisses Congress’s 10-point plan for EBCs in Bihar as a ‘sham’
content: BJP national president and MP Sambit Patra alleged that the Congress had a long history of being opposed to the policy of reservation, particularly for the Other Backward Classes (OBCs).

title: Indrakeeladri sees surge in devotees on third day of Dasara festivities
content: Nearly 58,000 devotees thronged the hillock as the Kanaka Durga temple was thrown open for darshan from the early hours; temple authorities cancel ₹500 tickets and the VIP darshan slot in the afternoon considering Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan’s visit

title: Maharashtra rain: Government to provide compensation before Diwali to farmers, relax panchnama norms
content: Over the last five days, districts in Marathwada and the Western Maharashtra region faced a flood-like situation, with 10 dead, thousands of animals killed and people displaced, and crops on about 70 lakh acres have been damaged

title: No interim relief for journalist against gag order over reporting on Adani Enterprises
content: Delhi court issues notice to the company on media portal Newslaundry’s plea against ex-parte gag order

title: NFL Week 4 buzz: What we're hearing on Dart, Penix and early trade deadline talk
content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta, the looming trade deadline and more for Week 4.

title: Sources: OLB Smith out through Eagles' Nov. bye
content: Eagles outside linebacker Nolan Smith Jr. strained his triceps Sunday and now is expected to be sidelined through the team's Nov. 2 bye, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Ole Miss to start QB Chambliss vs. LSU
content: Trinidad Chambliss will start at QB again for Ole Miss in Saturday's showdown against LSU, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: Nats tap Red Sox exec to lead operations
content: As the Nationals head toward another last-place finish, they're finalizing a deal to bring in Red Sox assistant GM as the new head of baseball operations, sources told ESPN on Wednesday.

title: Sister Jean, 106, retires over health concerns
content: 106-year-old Jean Dolores Schmidt rose to prominence during Loyola Chicago's epic 2018 NCAA tournament Final Four run.

title: Guardians' Fry has facial fractures, out 6-8 weeks
content: Guardians designated hitter David Fry sustained a broken nose and facial fractures after he was hit in the face by a pitch from the Tigers' Tarik Skubal. The team said Fry is expected to need six to eight weeks to recover.

title: Sources: Rookie Bailey, rep part after draft drama
content: Jazz forward Ace Bailey is seeking a new manager following an NBA draft process in which his representatives reportedly told a team not to select Bailey, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Future CFP format still undecided after meeting
content: The future format of the College Football Playoff remains undecided after the CFP's management committee met briefly about it on Wednesday at the Big Ten's headquarters.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

title: Which stars vaulted up our list? Who dropped? NBA Rank 2025 enters the top 50
content: NBA Rank 2025 continues! See which top players just missed the top 10, and who made the biggest leaps this season.

title: Debate: Snubs, surprises -- and what's next for the top 10
content: Do LeBron, Steph Curry and KD belong in the top 10? Wemby is where?! Tackling big NBA Rank questions.

title: From just one A to ... how many F's?! Full regular-season grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Whether your team is headed to October or packing its bags for the offseason, how did 2025 measure up to expectations?

title: Drew Allar could be 'The Difference' for Penn State
content: Penn State ended last season in heartbreak again. Allar & Co. get their first shot at redemption Saturday.

title: Inside Lane Kiffin's effort to alter the narrative of his polarizing career
content: One of college football's most polarizing figures, the Ole Miss coach opens up about changing his image.

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: How will Bethpage Black play? Who is under the most pressure? We're breaking down the top storylines ahead of the 2025 Ryder Cup.

title: Brad Holmes rebuilt the Lions -- now he's eyeing NFL front offices
content: One of six Black GMs in the NFL, Holmes has helped inspire a franchise and a new generation of executives.

title: Why the NFL can't stop the illegal tactic teams are using to defend the tush push
content: Teams are using disconcerting signals on defense -- mimicking the snap count -- and the way the game is officiated makes it difficult to stop.

content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

content: Your draft-day plans might not have panned out, but new options have emerged ... sometimes on the same NFL team.

content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: From Liverpool to Wrexham, are U.S. owners taking over English football?
content: In 2025, 11 of the 20 Premier League teams are majority owned by U.S. groups, with many more in the lower leagues. What does it all mean, and where is it going?

title: Her on-field success was unparalleled. Now Alex Morgan aims for the same heights in business
content: World Cup champion Alex Morgan has swapped the locker room for the board room. It's a move the former USWNT star plotted for years.

title: Betting buzz: Colts flying up odds boards amid hot start
content: At 3-0, the Colts are now favored to win the AFC South after entering the season as underdogs to reach the playoffs.

title: Mike Gundy is out at Oklahoma State: Top candidates, transfers, recruits to watch
content: Gundy's long tenure in Stillwater is over. Who replaces the Pokes legend and who are the key players on the roster?

title: What's next for New York Liberty after firing Sandy Brondello?
content: Sandy Brondello seemingly had support from her players, but she's out after four seasons, including the 2024 WNBA title.

title: Philadelphia 76ers unveil Iverson-era throwback uniforms
content: The uniform unveiling celebrates the 25th anniversary of the 76ers' Eastern Conference championship-winning team.

title: Trees are back: Timberwolves unveil KG-era throwback uniforms
content: From 1998 to 2008, Minnesota wore this look, making eight straight playoff appearances and a West finals run.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: A look at every Power 4 team
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: 'Everybody's waiting for that moment': Ohtani gets set for his first two-way October
content: Whether he starts Game 1 on the mound or pitches in relief, Shohei Ohtani is primed to make even more history.

title: Isak's first Liverpool goal could be the start of something special
content: It may have been another disjointed display from Liverpool on Tuesday, but it was also another win. Add to that Alexander Isak's first goal for the club, and it's no wonder Arne Slot seems pleased.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs still insistent on Fernandes
content: Saudi Pro League clubs are reportedly linked to a move for Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

content: Our experts weigh in on Flagg and what type of fantasy production they expect out of him as a rookie.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: After studying a 160-year-old code, Supreme Court rescinds colonial Portugal’s grant of land parcels
content: The protracted court battle over the land began when the State administration, through the Collector, rescinded the Portuguese grants in 1974

title: Tamil Nadu Youth Congress organises ‘Vote Chori’ explainer event
content: Arun Bhasker, senior vice-president, Tamil Nadu Youth Congress, took everyone through a demonstration of how deletion forms were filled up fraudulently.

title: NIRF ranking system has to be objective, transparent, says Dharmendra Pradhan
content: The Education Minister says Union government is giving NIRF and NAAC institutions utmost autonomy, “but they have to function transparently and improve in their governance”

title: ED searches premises linked to BC Jindal group entities as part of FEMA probe
content: It is suspected that funds from India have been placed in  overseas entities owned by the group in contravention of provisions of the FEMA

title: Rockwool Group’s ₹550 crore Cheyyar plant to be operational from mid-2026
content: The Cheyyar plant will be larger than Rockwool’s existing facility in Gujarat and will serve as a key production hub for the company in India.

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu offers ‘silk vastrams’ to Tirumala temple
content: The Chief Minister underlines the need for construction of temples of Lord Venkateswara in all the capital cities of various States

title: Bhyrappa served as a lecturer for over two years in Hubballi
content: The noted writer shared a special bond with the twin cities, particularly Hubballi, as it was the place where one of his initial works was released

title: Madras High Court directs Ilaiyaraaja to implead Sony Music in case filed against Ajith Kumar-starrer Good Bad Ugly
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar says, in the copyright fight between music composers, producers & music labels, “the ultimate sufferers are music lovers”

title: CBSE to conduct Class 10, 12 board exams from February 17
content: This is the first time that board exams for Class 10 will be conducted twice in an academic session.

title: Kerala Cabinet approves Bill requiring universities to hold Syndicate meetings every two months; likely to be tabled during the ongoing Assembly session
content: Proposed legislation will also introduce a key provision requiring Vice-Chancellors to convene Syndicate meetings within seven days if formally requested by at least one-third of its members

title: Chef Madhampatty Rangaraj moves Madras High Court to restrain costume designer Joy Crizildaa from defaming him
content: He urges the court to restrain her from making false, malicious and defamatory statements against him in any form of media in order to protect his personality rights

title: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan visits Vijayawada Utsav 2025, praises Andhra Pradesh’s progress
content: The Vice-President lauds Vijayawada as a ‘hot city with cool people,’ visits Kanaka Durga temple during Dasara celebrations, and highlights the State’s rapid development under Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

title: WB CM announces compensation for electrocution deaths, urges CESC to follow suit
content: Nine people, which included eight in Kolkata had died of electrocution on Tuesday  and Ms. Banerjee had blamed CESC for the negligence

title: Makeover of three suburban railway stations nearing completion
content: Hafizpet, Huppuguda and HiTech City stations being redeveloped at a cost of ₹81.97 crore; expected to be ready for public use within the next three months

title: Karnataka Health Dept. foils inter-State female foeticide attempt
content: Officials carry out covert operation in Andhra Pradesh; Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao commends effort

title: Former IAS officer flags Election Commission of India website’s low cybersecurity score
content: The ECI website got a score of 15/100 on the Mozilla HTTP Observatory, which checks for certain basic cybersecurity hygiene measures; the score improved to 65 hours after ex-IAS Kannan Gopinathan posted on X about the score.

title: Supreme Court slams Maharashtra government for delay in Surendra Gadling trial in 2016 arson case
content: “For how many years will you put a person in custody without trial?” SC asks; directs State to file affidavit with timeline for concluding the trial; Mr. Gadling has been in custody for over six years

title: Civic workers launch indefinite protest seeking timely salary, direct recruitment
content: The day-and-night dharna has been launched in front of the office of the municipal corporation in Dharwad

title: Supreme Court lawyers want ‘corrections’ made to Collegium system
content: They flag the urgent need to usher in a “transparent and equitable framework” for appointment of judges in the top court and High Courts

title: Caleb Williams, Isaiah Rodgers join Madden NFL 26 Team of the Week 3
content: totw is a program that runs alongside the season and delivers weekly content releases featuring athletes who've had standout performances in the previous week's games . the champions and heroes categories feature players such as the Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown , Cleveland Browns running back Quinshon Judkins , and Pittsburgh Steelers defensive end T. J. Watt .

title: MLB playoff pressure rankings: Which World Series contenders must win now -- or else?
content: the answer is a little different for every team, and the force of that pressure changes with each passing season . the more success a team has without winning it all, the more the pressure builds up . only the Dodgers faithful are in a state of pure release -- because it won just last year .

title: YAC kings: How Mizzou, FSU, NC State and more are bringing back the run game
content: Florida State began the season with a paradigm-shifting blowout of Alabama . the Seminoles are back in the AP top 10 like 2024 never happened . sign up now Missouri is now 25-5 since the start of 2023 .

title: October or bust? Inside Juan Soto's roller-coaster first season as a Met
content: the Mets defeated the Cubs 9-7 in their final homestand of the 2025 season . it was the final wild-card playoff spot in the national league . they lost two of three to the San Diego Padres , then lost control of their destiny .

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in Week 4
content: the first major upset of the season ended with 72% of all entrants eliminated . this week, the Buffalo Bills are the largest favorites so far as they host the winless New Orleans Saints . the smaller the group, the better the pick the Bills - as immediate win probability matters more .

title: Futures of Giants' Brian Daboll, Joe Schoen hinge on Jaxson Dart's instant success
content: the new york Giants will start rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart in week 4 . the decision came down after coach Brian Daboll left the door open to a change on Monday . he will start until the Giants couldn't justify him being the starter .

title: 🪨 Has Clemson hit rock bottom in the Bottom 10?
content: "Pale September," a tan line from the bottom 10 headquarters, is coming to a close . the days remaining in September have dwindled into single digits, soon to be followed by single-digit temperatures in those pools . for many, September can't wrap up soon enough, he says .

title: The inside scoop on Jerry Jones' business ways
content: it has been a common practice for Jones and executive vice president Stephen Jones over the years to engage with their star players in hopes of convincing them to sign a new deal . there is nothing in the collective bargaining agreement that explicitly prevents the discussions . several agents said it is not a good look to circumvent them and go to the player who might not know all the details .
